```{r setup, include=FALSE}
require("httr")
require("jsonlite")
```

## R Markdown


```{r}
base_url <- "https://records.nhl.com/site/api"
tab_name <- "franchise"
full_url <- paste0(base_url, "/", tab_name)
get_response <- GET(full_url)
json_contents <- content(get_response, "text")
list_res <- fromJSON(json_contents, flatten = TRUE)
#str(list_res$data)
list_res$data
#get_prices_df <- as.data.frame(json_res)

#filter(list_res$data, list_res$data$teamCommonName == "Canadiens")
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r}
base_url <- "https://records.nhl.com/site/api"
tab_name <- "franchise-team-totals"
id_filter <- paste0("cayenneExp=franchiseId=","17")
full_url <- paste0(base_url, "/", tab_name, "?", id_filter)
get_response <- GET(full_url)
json_contents <- content(get_response, "text")
list_res <- fromJSON(json_contents, flatten = TRUE)
#str(list_res$data)
list_res$data
#get_prices_df <- as.data.frame(json_res)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
